column9: C1. Laying bitumen on the Bloomfield Track would be beneficial for the environment
column10: C2. I don't know if improving the Bloomfield Track would lead to a rapid acceleration of development in the area to the detriment of the environment.
column11: C3. In deciding on what to do with the Bloomfield Track I don't know whether it's more important to meet the needs of the community or the environment.
column12: C4. Whilst impacts on locals in the Bloomfield area are a concern, it is the broader community that should carry more weight when deciding what to do with the Bloomfield Track.
column13: C5. I don't know what the people of Bloomfield think about the Bloomfield Track.
column14: C6. The road is just the 'thin edge of the wedge'. This may not happen for a long time, but it will happen.
column15: C7. Erosion from the Bloomfield Track is permanently damaging the coral reefs that fringe the beaches below
column16: C8. When it comes to the Bloomfield track, people living in Cairns are in no position to judge what the interests of the local residents of Bloomfield are.
column17: C9. If the Bloomfield Track is sealed (bitumenized) there will not be a rapid increase in environmentally damaging development in the Daintree area in the future It may even benefit the environment there.
column18: C10. No development should be permitted in World Heritage areas such as the Daintree.
column19: C11. I would be worse off if more of the Daintree rainforest is protected.
column20: C12. The Bloomfield Track issue is important for Queensland.
column21: C13. I'm not sure if the future of the Bloomfield Track should be determined by locals, outsiders or both.
column22: C14. The fate of the Bloomfield Track is of no concern to me.
column23: C15. Economic development associated with the Bloomfield Track will provide more opportunities for future generations in North Queensland.
column24: C16. The future of the Bloomfield Track should be determined by everyone and not just by those who live in the Bloomfield area.
column25: C17. I don't know how, but I think that there must be some way in which everybody benefits from protecting the rainforest near the Bloomfield Track.
column26: C18. The Bloomfield Track is important because it allows quick access to remote areas of the North.
column27: C19. Conservation in the Daintree area is worthwhile at whatever cost.
column28: C20. Using cars on the Bloomfield Track is bad for the rainforest.
column29: C21. Any decision about the Bloomfield Track will greatly affect people like me.
column30: C22. I have no idea what the people in the Bloomfield area think about the Bloomfield Track.
column31: C23. Erosion from the Bloomfield Track does not cause siltation or damage to the fringing inshore reefs between Cape Tribulation and Cooktown
column32: C24. If we don't take steps to protect the Daintree Rainforest future generations will miss out on the opportunity to experience the area as we do now.
column33: C25. We don't need to worry too much about environmental damage in the Daintree region because future generations will be better able to deal with these problems than we are.
column34: C26. There is no reason to believe that the Daintree Rainforest is under threat.
column35: C27. If future generations could have their say about the Bloomfield track, they would be less concerned about the environmental impacts than many people make out.
column36: C28. The protection of plants and animals in the Daintree is OK so long as it doesn't affect me.
column37: C29. Let's fix the problems in the Daintree just for now. The future will take care of itself.
column38: C30. The more that it is possible for the average North Queensland resident can access the Bloomfield Track the better
column39: C31. I don't like how development is creeping further and further North into the Daintree and beyond because of its effect on the environment.
column40: C32. The coral reefs along the foreshore below the Bloomfield Track are not badly affected by the road.
column41: C33. Native animals in the Daintree need protection because they have a right to life which cannot be traded against economic considerations.
column42: C34. The Wujal Wujal Community is better off now that the Bloomfield Track has been built.
column43: C35. The most important use of the Bloomfield Track is for tourism.
column44: C36. I'm concerned that I will be made worse off by any decision about the Bloomfield Track.
column45: C37. I think that both short and long term perspectives are needed in deciding what should be done with the Bloomfield Track, but I don't know which one is more important.
column46: C38. The Bloomfield Track may not have been the best idea, but I guess there is probably little point in closing it now that it has been built.
column47: C39. I don't really know who benefits most from the protection of Rainforest in the Daintree.
column48: C40. A long term perspective on the Bloomfield Track is essential.
column49: C41. When it comes to the Bloomfield Track, it's not important to worry about what the future will hold
column50: C42. Everyone in Queensland is better off for having a road like the Bloomfield Track.
